instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2327: What is 820-2327? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.CHGR_ACOK: What is CHGR_ACOK? This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light on charger
threads.message:
i've got this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, i know its an old one. it doesnt show a green light on the charger after water damage. i started taking messurements around the <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> chip and found a strange reading on <SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE</SIGNAL>- 16v on pin one of <RESISTOR>R7001</RESISTOR> .04v on pin 2. check resistance of <RESISTOR>R7001</RESISTOR> to find it has 62kohms, checked the resistor <RESISTOR>R7098</RESISTOR> to find 280ohms instead of 100kohm, removed <RESISTOR>R7098</RESISTOR> checked resistance at the pads and still had 280ohms resistance.

for some reason im not getting chgr acok out of the <CHIP>ISL6285</CHIP> but not sure about the 280ohs resistance on <RESISTOR>R7098</RESISTOR>.

any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light on charger
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7000</TRANSISTOR> is dead, but should not affect the green light. Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7000</TRANSISTOR> but ISL is probably dead too

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light on charger
threads.message: i changed the <TRANSISTOR>Q7000</TRANSISTOR> that fixed the issue now i got short to ground on <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>, removed <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> found short on <SIGNAL>CHAR_ACOK</SIGNAL> pad , checked <SIGNAL>SMH_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> found short is in the smc. This thing is too old to replace the smc so its going in the donor pile.
